material.mattext: The null hypothesis in this case is:
The mean IQ level of people who were reared by their biological parents is higher than the mean of those who were not.
The mean IQ level of people who were reared by their biological parents is lower than the mean of those who were not.
There is no difference in mean IQ level between people who were reared by their natural parents and those who those who were not.
There is a difference in mean IQ level between people who were reared by their natural parents and those who those who were not.

Incorrect. Recall that the null hypothesis claims that "nothing special is going on"; no change from the status quo, no relationship, no difference etc.). The claim you chose indicates that something is going on.

Incorrect. Recall that the null hypothesis claims that "nothing special is going on"; no change from the status quo, no relationship, no difference etc.) The claim you chose indicates that something is going on.
Good Job! Indeed the null hypothesis claims that "nothing special is going on", which in this context is that there is no difference in mean IQ levels between the two groups.

Incorrect. Recall that the null hypothesis claims that "nothing special is going on"; no change from the status quo, no relationship, no difference etc.) The claim you chose indicates that something is going on.
